Articles.Content:
Working on eve now for the pack, I'm going for a darkish depressing look on it. What do you guys think? Too dark?

I like it. Looks intimidating, foreboding... the way a Venus analogue should be.

http://i.imgur.com/zscqAR4.jpg

Working on eve now for the pack, I'm going for a darkish depressing look on it. What do you guys think? Too dark?

Nah it looks super mysterious and intriguing, I like having one dark, spooky planet, makes more use for lights and the thick atmosphere will add to its mystery thanks what I think anyway

http://imgur.com/a/HTPFE

Testing out fake shading for my pack, looks surprisingly good.

How does it work? Are the textures actually darker in colour on the underside? Or is it doing this relative to the suns direction?

keep eve as scary as before.

I'll see what can be done >:].

Also I tried using 3 textures, looking good but more edges to fix.

Poor guy.

Edited April 13, 2014 by Astronomer
Just make sure he lands on his helmet. He'll be fiiiiiiiine.
Looks awsome keep at this work

How does it work? Are the textures actually darker in colour on the underside? Or is it doing this relative to the suns direction?

1) Nope, the 3 particles rotate, so making it like that wouldn't work.

2) Not now, but i could try to make it do that. I won't tell my secret yet, but I'll tell you, I'm surprised nobody else thought of this.

Here's what I got so far -

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited April 13, 2014 by Thesonicgalaxy
Is the secret just two layers of clouds with the bottom ones being grey?

Is the secret just two layers of clouds with the bottom ones being grey?

Pretty much :T
astronomer just make differn versions then some like them puffy some like them more shaper. also once he opens up mod to more .cfg changes might bealbe to have differnt .cfg for each planets clouds

1) Nope, the 3 particles rotate, so making it like that wouldn't work.

2) Not now, but i could try to make it do that. I won't tell my secret yet, but I'll tell you, I'm surprised nobody else thought of this.

Here's what I got so far - http://imgur.com/a/l2OJ2

Wow. Nice shadows too, looks great

1) Nope, the 3 particles rotate, so making it like that wouldn't work.

Very nice. Question, though: is the first image with different settings? Somehow the clouds look... patchier. More like overlapping polygons than a single mass. Or is it just me?

Very nice. Question, though: is the first image with different settings? Somehow the clouds look... patchier. More like overlapping polygons than a single mass. Or is it just me?

It's just the angle. The shading is a huge wip.

1) Nope, the 3 particles rotate, so making it like that wouldn't work.

2) Not now, but i could try to make it do that. I won't tell my secret yet, but I'll tell you, I'm surprised nobody else thought of this.

Here's what I got so far - http://imgur.com/a/l2OJ2

Nice! I'm hoping to make this native in the shader though. The "shadows" are a nice touch.

Ok so now I'm asking that Astronomer and Sonic combine their efforts and release something together !

You both are doing amazing work on top of rbray's essential creation.

While you're adding layers you should throw in some hight variance for the clouds, build some 'real' 3D clouds to fly around. I'm thinking cumulonimbus.. or was rbray working on something like this for next release?

Edited April 13, 2014 by pingopete

While you're adding layers you should throw in some hight variance for the clouds, build some 'real' 3D clouds to fly around. I'm thinking cumulonimbus.. or was rbray working on something like this for next release?

That's what I'll work on now.

Okay, now I can't save to Kerbin at all. It's saving it in the config, but it won't load it. It won't load any more layers.

UPDATE: Okay, I really can't deal with this anymore. I might just stop all development of my pack until you fix your saving system. It's way too buggy. I mean, i can't even bloody save anymore. This is a major bug.

UPDATE 2: Okay, apparently there were layers that wouldn't let me save on kerbin. Okay...

Edited April 13, 2014 by Thesonicgalaxy

At least side-wind landing will be more challenging... turbulence will be even better, though it will need a complex atmosphere model i guess...

I could do without turbulence my planes jiggle themselves apart without any

Aside from all the joy and hype going on with these cloud packs(btw Sonic those clouds are SO GOOD! all you need is weather. ), I'm having some pretty big issues getting even the rbray's clouds to work(the DEFAULT ones). I've put the BoulderCo folder (I'm using Advanced Textures btw) into GameData, launched the game, and the clouds don't show AT ALL. So, I put the folder EnvironmentalEnhancements(or whatever it's called) into the Plugins folder, launched the game, and NOTHING shows AGAIN. What is going on?!

Aside from all the joy and hype going on with these cloud packs(btw Sonic those clouds are SO GOOD! all you need is weather. ), I'm having some pretty big issues getting even the rbray's clouds to work(the DEFAULT ones). I've put the BoulderCo folder (I'm using Advanced Textures btw) into GameData, launched the game, and the clouds don't show AT ALL. So, I put the folder EnvironmentalEnhancements(or whatever it's called) into the Plugins folder, launched the game, and NOTHING shows AGAIN. What is going on?!
You put the EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements folder in GameData as well. Thanks btw.
Oh! Makes sense. :3 Also, your mod has inspired me greater to go into meteorology in college, rbray, Astronomer, Proot, and you! Thanks, and keep up the good work!

I'm reinstalling rbray's base mod for you guys' texture addons. I hope it'll work this time. It's the 4th time I've downloaded it in the past HOUR.

EDIT: NOPE! Nothing. Zilch. Zero. No Textures for clouds, city lights, volumetric clouds, NONE OF THAT.

Edited April 13, 2014 by KyleofKerbin

Hmm... I still don't see any textures anywhere... I have no idea what is going on!

Can you post a picture of your GameData folder?
heh, when a huge cloud section rolls by, the shading make it look like a storm.
